intro: Phacelia austrotexana, commonly known as the Texas phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Phacelia austrotexana is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
